name: Throwing Master
description:
Throwing Master is a casual competitive game played by two to four players, who make decisions based on the rules of the game and choose their preferred weapon to defeat their opponent.

- Requires at least 2-4 players to play.

- Players set the rules of the game, choose the scene to fight.

- Every scene has its own rules.

- "Bamboo Forest", "Amusement Park", and "Mountain Top" have similar rules, and score points by capturing more land, with the player with the highest score winning. They are the standard model.

- In Standard mode, weapons that disappear at the end of a turn are marked as active weapons. The earlier the weapon drops, the higher the priority of their valid mark.

-Valid tags with larger sequences are corrupted by valid tags with smaller sequences.

- Scenes "Castle War" and "Desert" are special rules

-Castle Wars requires the player's duck knight to snatch an opponent's flag in order to win.

- "Desert" requires player-controlled birds to avoid obstacles and shoot down opponents' nests to win.
